trans-unit.source: title: Step 7: Export and import a virtual machine
trans-unit.target: title: Step 7: Export and import a virtual machine

trans-unit.source: Step 7: Export and import a virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Step 7: Export and import a virtual machine

trans-unit.source: 12-Nov update.Test update to validate Bug 451748.
trans-unit.target: 12-Nov update.Test update to validate Bug 451748.

trans-unit.source: You can quickly copy a virtual machine or move a virtual machine by using the export and import functionality.
trans-unit.target: You can quickly copy a virtual machine or move a virtual machine by using the export and import functionality.

trans-unit.source: Export the VM
trans-unit.target: Export the VM

trans-unit.source: Exporting a virtual machine exports all of the pieces of the VM, including the checkpoints.
trans-unit.target: Exporting a virtual machine exports all of the pieces of the VM, including the checkpoints.

trans-unit.source: In Hyper-V Manager, right-click the virtual machine and select Export.
trans-unit.target: In Hyper-V Manager, right-click the virtual machine and select Export.

trans-unit.source: Click Browse in the dialog box and navigate to C:\Users\Public and then click Select Folder.
trans-unit.target: Click Browse in the dialog box and navigate to C:\Users\Public and then click Select Folder.

trans-unit.source: In the Export Virtual Machine dialog, make sure the path looks okay and then click Export.
trans-unit.target: In the Export Virtual Machine dialog, make sure the path looks okay and then click Export.

trans-unit.source: While the VM is being exported, you can see the progress in the Status section:
trans-unit.target: While the VM is being exported, you can see the progress in the Status section:

trans-unit.source: Did the export work?
trans-unit.target: Did the export work?

trans-unit.source: To verify that the virtual machine was exported, right-click on your Start menu and select File Explorer.
trans-unit.target: To verify that the virtual machine was exported, right-click on your Start menu and select File Explorer.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to C:\Users\Public\Windows Walkthrough VM.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to C:\Users\Public\Windows Walkthrough VM.

trans-unit.source: You should see another folder called Windows Walkthrough VM and inside that folder should be three folders with the files for your exported virtual machine:
trans-unit.target: You should see another folder called Windows Walkthrough VM and inside that folder should be three folders with the files for your exported virtual machine:

trans-unit.source: Snapshots
trans-unit.target: Snapshots

trans-unit.source: Virtual Hard Disks
trans-unit.target: Virtual Hard Disks

trans-unit.source: Virtual Machines
trans-unit.target: Virtual Machines

trans-unit.source: Import the VM
trans-unit.target: Import the VM

trans-unit.source: Before we import the VM, we are going to delete the original VM.
trans-unit.target: Before we import the VM, we are going to delete the original VM.

trans-unit.source: Right-click on the VM and select Delete.
trans-unit.target: Right-click on the VM and select Delete.

trans-unit.source: In Hyper-V Manager, in the Action menu, click Import Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: In Hyper-V Manager, in the Action menu, click Import Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: In the Locate Folder section, click Browse and navigate to C:\Users\Public\Windows Walkthrough VM and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: In the Locate Folder section, click Browse and navigate to C:\Users\Public\Windows Walkthrough VM and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: In the Select virtual machine to import screen click Next.
trans-unit.target: In the Select virtual machine to import screen click Next.

trans-unit.source: In the Choose Import Type section, select Register the virtual machine in place and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: In the Choose Import Type section, select Register the virtual machine in place and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: In the Choose Destination section, leave the default and click Next.
trans-unit.target: In the Choose Destination section, leave the default and click Next.

trans-unit.source: In Choose Storage folders, leave the default path and click Next.
trans-unit.target: In Choose Storage folders, leave the default path and click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the summary page you'll see a list of the paths where the new VM files will be located.
trans-unit.target: On the summary page you'll see a list of the paths where the new VM files will be located.

trans-unit.source: Click Finish to start the import.
trans-unit.target: Click Finish to start the import.

trans-unit.source: Did the import work?
trans-unit.target: Did the import work?

trans-unit.source: To make sure the import worked, just double-click the VM in Hyper-V Manager and launch VMConnect to check the VM.
trans-unit.target: To make sure the import worked, just double-click the VM in Hyper-V Manager and launch VMConnect to check the VM.

trans-unit.source: Next Step:
trans-unit.target: Next Step:
